plot: John Oliver examines the US vice presidential candidates, then delves into Hawaii's historical mistreatment of native Hawaiians. He acknowledges the complexity of the issues, offering suggestions for improvements.

John Oliver starts with the VP choices from the largest two parties in United states. Later he deep-dive to the issue where he explains how Hawaii has long been doing everything for the benefit of everyone else but the native Hawaiians. He admits these issues cannot be solved overnight and suggested few points where everyone can start from.—Niaz Islam Arif
